data: Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate and temperature pre CAR-T Cell Infusion
During CAR-T Cell Infusion and for a minimum of 2 hours post infusion or until reading returns to pre-infusion baseline
q15min, blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature during CAR-T Cell Infusion, and for 1 hour post-infusion, then q1h for 2 hour post-infusion, then q2h for 4 hours
q15min, during CAR-T Cell Infusion, and for 1 hour post-infusion, then q1h for 2 hour post-infusion, then q2h for 4 hours
Do not order corticosteroid during CAR-T Cell infusion unless directed by attending physician
Absolutely no corticosteroid use during CAR-T Cell infusion unless directed by attending physician
12.5 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab
12.5 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq
Management of Symptoms During / After Infusion
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: tab
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: oral liq
0.15 mg/kg, IV, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form:inj
0.5 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN Other (see comment), drug form: inj
Notify attending provider prior to commencing thaw of CAR-T Cells

PLACEHOLDER: Administer - Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Infusion. A physician must be present and in the room during infusion of thawed CAR-T cells preserved in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) and be immediately available for 3 to 4 hours following infusion. Do NOT filter. If infusion is stopped before completion, and the symptoms causing cessation of the infusion have returned to baseline within 30 minutes, the infusion may be restarted. 
STOP infusion immediately if systolic BP drops:
- greater than 15% from baseline
- below 80 mmHg for patients greater than or equal to 12 years old
- below 70 mmHg for patients less than 12 years old
